text.citation: Rau, D. V., & Dong, M. N. (2006). Yami texts with reference grammar and dictionary. Institute of Linguistics, Academia Sinica.
text.BibTeX_citation: @book{rau2006yami, title={Yami texts with reference grammar and dictionary}, author={Rau, D Victoria and Dong, Maa-Neu}, year={2006}, publisher={Institute of Linguistics, Academia Sinica}}
text.source: ['15. kavavatanen no tazokok', 'tazokok鳥的故事', 'The story of the tazokok bird', '', 'si apen Yohani (F, 49, Iranmilek)', '江秀玉，女，49，東清村', '']

S.FORM: kavavatanen no tazokok nokakoa ori am, maci-lolo o anak na do ina na ori am.
S.TRANSL: 很久以前，有一個關於tazokok鳥的故事。一個小孩子想跟他的母親一起上山
There was a story of the tazokok bird. A child wanted to go with her mother into the mountains.

S.FORM: “ji ka ngai, mo koimo, ta to ka mang-ine-ynara so tazokok am, toktok-an na o mata mo no tazokok” koan na.
S.TRANSL: “喂，你不要跟來，因為你會模仿tazokok鳥叫聲，它們會挖了你的眼睛吃” 他說
“Hey, don’t follow me, for you will copy the call of a tazokok bird and they will come and peck your eyes out.

S.FORM: “a ji abo a, ma-ngay ko jimo saon am” koan na am, ji na pa-sovay-i no niapoan na am, to na rana pa-lolo-a o anak na.
S.TRANSL: “不會啦，我要跟你去” 他說，他的母親拗不過他，就只好帶他一起上山去了
“No, I want to go with you.” The mother could not dissuade her child, so she took her with her.

S.FORM: karaan am, ma-sasnad sira do yan-an da ori o mi-ina ori am, am-ian do ka-tangked da so “me, me, tazokok! tazokok!” koan na do ka-viao-an ori am, to na pa neleh-an ori no anak na ori a.
S.TRANSL: 他們母女倆到了目的地後，他們就聽到田邊的蘆葦叢裡有tazokok鳥“嗯，嗯，tazokok,tazokok” 的叫聲。小孩子就當作沒有聽到
When the two of them got to the area, they heard a tazokok crying out from the reeds. “Un, un, tazokok, tazokok,” it cried. The child didn’t pay any attention.

S.FORM: ipí-doa so ka-pi-zi-ziak na ori a, “me, me, tazokok! tazokok!” koan na ori am.
S.TRANSL: 第二次，tazokok鳥又“嗯，嗯，tazokok！tazokok！” 叫的時候
The tazokok cried for a second time,“tazokok! tazokok!”

S.FORM: ma-níring o anak na ori am, “me, me, tazokok! tazokok!” koan na ori no anak na am.
S.TRANSL: 小孩子就“嗯，嗯，tazokok！tazokok！” 的模仿鳥在叫
“Un, un, tazokok, tazokok,” the child copied the bird.

S.FORM: “taona, ji mo ng-in-inara-i koan ko imo ori, mo pi-aavoada, mi ta rana, mo pi-aavoada”.
S.TRANSL: “啊喲，我不是跟你說過不可以模仿的嗎？真是的；走了！我們回家去”
“Oh, I told you not to copy the bird, but you did. We have to go.”

S.FORM: koan na no tazokok, mo ina am, “mo to ng-in-inara-i jiaken, ji abo ka-ji ko ang-sem-an so mata mo a” koan na.
S.TRANSL: 媽，tazokok說“你為什麼學我叫？，我非挖了你的眼睛吃不可” 它說
“Mom, tazokok told me, ‘You copied me, now I am going to eat your eyeballs raw’.

S.FORM: “ta ori, mo pi-aavoada, ji ka ngai koan ko imo ori a, ji ka maci-’eza koan ko imo ori, mo ka-kmi cinoklan a, a ma-noyong ori a ciring no tazokok?”
S.TRANSL: “你看看，我說你不要來，你不要跟來的嘛，真是的。你剛才說的，tazokok鳥真的是這麼說嗎？”
“I told you not to come, and not to follow. Is what the bird said for real?”

S.FORM: “nona, ya ji a-noyong a”, “a mi ta rana, mo ka-vazat” koan na.
S.TRANSL: “當然是真的啊” ，“那我們快走吧，真是的” 他的母親說
“Of course it’s real.” “Then let’s get out of here, idiot,” her mother said.

S.FORM: to na rana pi-sin-sinmó-a no ina na o ni-key-kali na ori a, karaan am, m-oli rana sira.
S.TRANSL: 於是他的母親趕緊收拾他挖好的（芋頭/地瓜），然後他們就回家去了
Her mother packed everything up, including (the taro and sweet potato) they had dug up, and they went back home.

W.TRANSL: 動綴-疊-收拾集中-受焦.虛

S.FORM: karaan am, to da rana a-cíta o tazokok ori a maci-’eza jira a.
S.TRANSL: 不久，他們發現tazokok已經在跟隨他們來了
Afterwards, they found the tazokok had followed them.

S.FORM: “o ito rana, mo pi-aavoada, awalay!” to sia ma-la-láyo ori o mi-ina ori a.
S.TRANSL: “啊呀，你看，它們來了！” ，他們母女倆開始用跑的
“Look, it’s coming! We are dead meat!” The two of them ran back toward home.

S.FORM: to ma-la-láyo sira om-oli am, mapa-zeveng rana sira ori a.
S.TRANSL: 他們用跑的回家去，然後就趕緊把門關上
They kept on running, and when they got home they closed the door.

S.FORM: ma-níring o tazokok ori am, “yaten tamo rana sira aro a zipo-zipos ta am, ma-ngay tamo do ili,
S.TRANSL: tazokok鳥說“我們這群有親戚關係的tazokok鳥，大家一起到村莊去
The tazokok bird said, “We are all relatives (tazokok birds) with one another. Let’s go to the village.

S.FORM: ciaha ta ko rana ka-teng-an o vahay da, ta ko ni-ma-cita sira,
S.TRANSL: 我已經知道他們的住家。我看見他們了”
It’s OK! I already know where they live. I saw them.

S.FORM: ya asa ka ka-nak-an o ya ni-om-inara jiaken, tazokok! tazokok! koan na yaken am,
S.TRANSL: 有一個小孩模仿我，學我“tazokok, tazokok” 的叫
A child copied my ‘tazokok, tazokok’ call.

S.FORM: “ji abo ka-ji tamo i ang-sem-an so mata da i”, “nohon a”, ratateng am, aro rana sira ori a tazokok a om-oli do ili a.
S.TRANSL: “我們非吃了他們的眼睛不可” ，“是的” 。很多的tazokok鳥成群的飛去村莊
We must go eat their eyeballs raw.” “All right!” the rest of the birds said. The group of tazokok birds went together toward the village.

S.FORM: “a wajin do jia o.”, “o ya do jia o vahay da”, to na manóm-an sira no ni-s-om-ozi ori a tazokok ori a.
S.TRANSL: “他們的 在哪裡？” 那隻生氣的tazokok鳥領著它們說；“就是這一家了”
“Where are they?” “This is their house,” the angry bird that led them said.

S.FORM: ratateng am, “o ya o vahay da, da ni-sdep-an no ka-nak-an ang”, “nohon”.
S.TRANSL: “這就是他們的家，小孩子就是進入了這個家” “是的”
“This is the house. The kid went in here.” “Yes.”

S.FORM: karaan am, s-om-dep sira am, ni-slet-an da o vahay da.
S.TRANSL: 於是它們就要進屋裡去，但門已鎖上
They tried to get in, but the door was locked.

S.FORM: “a ma-kong takamo so wajin ya, da ni-mímin a ni-sle-slet-an o vahay da ito?”.
S.TRANSL: “我們怎麼辦？他們已經把所有的門都鎖上了”
“What can we do? They have locked all the doors.”

S.FORM: ikongodo anito pa nokakoa, to sia maci-siri-síring a, ma-teneng pa sira a mi-ziziak o tazokok ori a.
S.TRANSL: 由於早期還是鬼的世界，tazokok不只會說人話，還能與人類溝通
Because the early days were the days of the ghosts, the birds not only were able to communicate with people, but they also could speak in human tongue.

S.FORM: “na, no k-om-oan am, kabkab-en takamo o vahay da, me, me, tazokok! kabkab-en takamo o vahay da”,
S.TRANSL: “這樣吧，我們拆掉他們的屋頂。嗯，嗯，tazokok，我們掀開他們的屋頂”
“If this is so, then we might as well tear open their roof. Un, un, tazokok, let’s tear open their roof.”

S.FORM: to rana a-cita o pakaw ori am, to sia rana andep a, “me, me, wajin sira do jia” koan da,
S.TRANSL: 屋頂掀開以後，天花板就露了出來，它們就從天花板鑽進了屋裡。“嗯，嗯，他們到哪裡去了？” 鳥說
After the roof was torn away, the ceiling showed, and they went through the ceiling into the house. “Un, un, where did they go?” the birds cried.

S.FORM: “me, me, kala-en tamo pala sira” koan da, kala-en da sira am ma-kala da sira,
S.TRANSL: 它們說“嗯，嗯，我們找找看” ，可是它們找遍了也找不著他們。
“Un, un, let’s look for them,” they said. They looked all over but couldn’t find them.

S.FORM: karaan am, toktok-an da rana o mata da oso-en da, mimín-en da o mata da oso-en a.
S.TRANSL: 後來它們就開始啄他們的眼睛，把他們所有人的眼睛都挖起來吃
They gouged out all of their eyes.

S.FORM: asi-asisi da sira ori am, ikongo ji da ni-koi-koil do asi-asisi da.
S.TRANSL: 就連他們的身上的肉也都挑（啄）起來
They even pulled off some of their flesh.

S.FORM: “beken, ji ko angay jimo a” koan na, “ji ka ngai, ta to mo ng-in-inára-i o tazokok”.
S.TRANSL: “不，我要跟你去” 小孩說，“你不要來，你會模仿tazokok鳥叫聲”
“No, I want to go with you,” the child said. “Don’t come, for you will copy the call of a tazokok bird.”

S.FORM: “nohon, me, me, kabkab-en takamo” koan da am to da ngabkab-i ori a.
S.TRANSL: “好！嗯，嗯，我們掀掉他們的屋頂” 它們說。它們就掀開了他們的屋頂
“Okay, un, un, we’ll tear open their roof,” they said, and they tore open the roof.

S.FORM: “me, me, vawa-en tamo pala o kazapaz an”, vawa-en da o kazapaz am, ma-dpon sira dang ori a.
S.TRANSL: “嗯，嗯，我們掀開這個竹篩” ，他們就把竹篩掀開來一看，原來他們全部都集中在竹篩底下
“Un, un, let’s look under the sifter made of bamboo.” When they looked underneath, they found the entire family under there.

S.FORM: karaan am, akpeh-en da rana do kazapaz ori ori am, i-salap da rana no aro a tazokok o asisi da am mata-mata da asa ka vahay ori, ori o kavavatanen no tazokok.
S.TRANSL: tazokok把挖（啄）掉的眼睛，還有他們一家人的肉都集中放在竹篩裡帶著飛走了。這就是tazokok的故事
Tazokok placed all the eyeballs and flesh on the bamboo sifter and flew away with them. This is the story of the tazokok.
